meanings.definition: A person who informs on others; a police informant.
meanings.sent1: The narc told the police about the illegal activity.
meanings.sent2: The narc provided valuable information to the authorities.
meanings.sent3: The narc's tip led to the capture of the criminal.
meanings.sent4: Being a narc can be a dangerous job, but it helps keep the community safe.
meanings.sent5: The narc's identity must be kept secret to protect them from retaliation.

meanings.definition: To act as a police informant.
meanings.sent1: He decided to narc on his former partners to avoid jail time.
meanings.sent2: She chose to narc to help the police solve the case.
meanings.sent3: The criminal was surprised when his friend decided to narc on him.
meanings.sent4: Sometimes, people narc because they want to make things right.
meanings.sent5: Narcing on someone is a serious decision with consequences for all involved.

meanings.definition: A law enforcement officer who investigates narcotics violations.
meanings.sent1: The narc seized a large amount of illegal drugs during the raid.
meanings.sent2: Narcs work tirelessly to combat drug trafficking in the city.
meanings.sent3: The narc's dog helped sniff out the hidden narcotics.
meanings.sent4: The narc's dedication to the job earned them a commendation.
meanings.sent5: Becoming a narc requires specialized training and skills in law enforcement.
